name: Cook the Book: Steak and Eggs with Papaya, Banana, and Grand Marnier Shake
description: In one memorable episode of Top Chef's Season Three, the contestants were asked to make Padma Lakshmi breakfast. Hung Huynh (who went on to become the season's Top Chef) prepared the winning dish of Steak and Eggs with Papaya, Banana,...
recipeIngredient: 2 cups peeled, seeded, and diced papaya
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 small onion, cut into 1/4 inch slices

recipeInstructions.text: In a blender, combine the papaya, banana, milk, ice, liqueur, and lemon juice, if using. Blend until smooth, add honey to taste, and blend to combine. Pour into a tall, chilled glass.

Season the steak with salt and pepper on both sides. Heat the oil in a medium sauté pan or skillet over high heat. Add the steak and cook for 3 to 4 minutes on each side for medium-rare, or to desired doneness. Add the eggs and cook to the desired firmness. Remove to a serving plate and set aside to rest.

Return the pan to the heat and add the onion and mushrooms; cook, stirring, until just softened and browned, about five minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Spoon the onion and mushrooms onto the plate next to the steak and eggs, and serve immediately.
